snippet: Officials hope that any new measures will have more impact than the economic sanctions imposed on Moscow so far.
abstract: Officials in Europe and America are searching for strong and appropriate response to Russia's incursion into Ukraine; are meeting to assemble new package of sanctions targeting Russia’s banking, energy and defense sectors, but hold little hope that Moscow will reverse course; frustration at inability to deter Moscow follows a shift on the battlefield, where Russian troops have turned the tide in favor of Ukrainian separatists.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and STEVEN ERLANGER
byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and Steven Erlanger from London. Alison Smale contributed reporting from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: Officials hope that any new measures will have more impact than the economic sanctions imposed on Moscow so far.

headline.main: U.S. and Europe Are Struggling With Response to a Bold Russia
headline.print_headline: U.S. and Europe Are Struggling With Response to a Bold Russia

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
